summary: Email correspondence between Florence Hutner, General Counsel for the Office of Chief Medical Examiner (OCME), and an individual from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York regarding a FOIA request for Jeffrey Epstein's autopsy and toxicology reports. The emails discuss the conclusion of the federal investigation into Epstein's death and the release of a redacted autopsy report to The New York Times.

persons.name: Florence Hutner
persons.role: General Counsel, Office of Chief Medical Examiner (OCME)
persons.context: Corresponds with the U.S. Attorney's Office regarding FOIA requests for Jeffrey Epstein's autopsy and toxicology reports, seeking confirmation on the status of the federal investigation and the release of documents.

persons.name: Mark Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned as having an attorney who was given a courtesy notice about the release of the redacted autopsy report.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Subject of the FOIA requests for his autopsy and toxicology reports following his death in custody.

connections.description: Hutner, as OCME General Counsel, handles legal matters related to the release of Epstein's autopsy and toxicology reports.
Mark Epstein is identified as Jeffrey Epstein's brother.

events.title: Release of Redacted Autopsy Report
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office provides a redacted copy of Jeffrey Epstein's autopsy report to Florence Hutner at OCME and notifies Mark Epstein's attorney.

events.title: FOIA Inquiry on Toxicology Report
events.description: Florence Hutner inquires about the status of the federal investigation into Epstein's death and whether the NYT has published the redacted autopsy report, in relation to a public FOIA request for the toxicology report.

locations: U.S. Attorney's Office Southern District of New York
keyFacts: The federal investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's death had concluded by August 2021, as confirmed in the email correspondence.
A redacted version of Jeffrey Epstein's autopsy report was produced to The New York Times, but it had not been published as of August 23, 2021.
Mark Epstein's attorney was given a courtesy notice about the release of the redacted autopsy report.
The Office of the Chief Medical Examiner received a public FOIA request for Epstein's toxicology report and sought guidance before responding.
